trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty"></xref> class encapsulates the properties of a message that has been read from a queue.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty> class is obtained from the channel context and is used primarily for error processing.

For example, if an application reads a message from the dead-letter queue, the application should examine properties like <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.DeliveryFailure%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.DeliveryStatus%2A>.
If an application is performing its own poison-message handling, it should examine properties like <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.AbortCount%2A>.
Gets an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value that indicates the number of times the message participated in the transaction that was aborted, that is, channel attempts - 1.
This property is used in poison-message handling.
For more information about poison-message handling, see [Poison Message Handling](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/poison-message-handling.md).
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value that indicates the number of times that the channel attempted to read this message.
Gets a value from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure"></xref> enumeration that indicates why the message failed delivery.
Use this property together with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.DeliveryStatus%2A> when reading a message from a dead-letter queue to determine why the message failed delivery.
A value from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure"></xref> enumeration that indicates why the message failed delivery.
May be `null`.
Gets a value from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus"></xref> enumeration that indicates the delivery status of the message.
A message may have a delivery status of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus.InDoubt> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus.NotDelivered>.

A message has a delivery status of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus.InDoubt> unless Message Queuing (MSMQ) can determine that it was not delivered, in which case its delivery status becomes <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus.NotDelivered>.
An example of an in-doubt message is a message that has expired.
Message Queuing cannot determine whether the message was delivered to the application after it expired.

Use this property together with <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty.DeliveryFailure%2A> when reading a message from a dead-letter queue to determine why the message failed delivery.
A value from the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus"></xref> enumeration that indicates the delivery status of the message.
May be `null`.
Gets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> whose properties are to be retrieved.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqMessageProperty"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref>.
The value is null or if property collection on the message is null.
Gets an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value that indicates the number of times the message has moved from the main queue to the subqueue or the other way.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> value that indicates the count of the number of times this message has been moved.
Gets a <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the string "MsmqMessageProperty".
A <xref:System.String> that contains the string "MsmqMessageProperty".
